content: Our distributable cash flow is adjusted for 3 Bear transaction cost was approximately $70 million in the third quarter, compared to $56 million in the third quarter of â21. In October, DKL extended its credit facility to $1.2 billion including senior secured revolving commitment of $900 million with a maturity date in October 27 and a new secured term loan of $300 million with a maturity date in October 24. In our Pipelines and Transportation segment, the third quarter of â22 contribution margin was $54 million compared to $47.4 million in the third quarter of â21. In our Wholesale Marketing and Terminalling segment, the contribution margin was $18.3 million in the third quarter compared to $19.6 million in the third quarter of '21. During the third quarter of 2022, equity income from our crude oil pipeline JVs was approximately $8.6 million compared to $7.3 million in the prior year period. Moving to capital expenditures, we spent approximately $32.2 million in the third quarter of '22, which consisted of $31.3 million of growth spending and $900,000 for sustaining maintenance.
